greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of covering antichains of subsets of {1..n} with no singletons and different edge-sizes.
comment: An antichain is a finite set of finite sets, none of which is a subset of any other. It is covering if its union is {1..n}. The edge-sizes are the numbers of vertices in each edge, so for example the edge sizes of {{1,3},{2,5},{3,4,5}} are {2,2,3}.
formula: a(n) = A326570(n) - n*a(n-1) for n > 0. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 13 2019
xref: Set partitions with different block sizes are A007837.
The case with singletons is A326570.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 18 2019
